Specific Details: Government support of indigenous Irish whiskey producers
DPOs Lobbied: Enda Kenny|Taoiseach|Department of the Taoiseach::Joan Burton|Tánaiste and Minister|Department of Social Protection::Seán Sherlock|Minister of State|Department of Foreign Affairs::David Stanton|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Sandra McLellan|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::John Paul O'Shea|Councillor|Cork County Council::Tom Barry|TD|Dáil Éireann, the Oireachtas::Mick Nugent|Councillor|Cork City Council
Subject Matter: Government support of indigenous Irish whiskey producers
Intended Results: Awareness building of the global export success of Jameson, the significant investments made in expanding production capacity in Ireland and the impact of domestic policy on export success
Lobbying Activities: Irish Distillers invited An Tanaiste Joan Burton to speak at the opening of the Irish Distillers Microdistillery in Midleton. Informal discussions at the event focused on the global success of Jameson Irish whiskey, the economic impact of the indigenous distilling industry, the importance of supportive domestic policies as underpinning export success, and the future growth of the Irish whiskey category. A number of local representatives (see DPO section) attended the event.|Event / Reception|1::Alexandre Ricard, CEO of Pernod Ricard, met with An Taoiseach Enda Kenny at an event in Paris. Discussions focused on the global success of Jameson Irish whiskey, the €220 million investment by Pernod Ricard in Irish Distillers' operations in Ireland, the importance of supportive domestic policies as underpinning export success, and the shared objective of tackling alcohol misuse and the most effective policy measures for addressing same.|Meeting|1::Alexandre Ricard, CEO of Pernod Ricard, sent An Taoiseach Enda Kenny a letter following their discussions in Paris, reiterating the points made.|Letter|1

Specific Details: Flooding in Midleton Town over Christmas and early January
DPOs Lobbied: Tim Lucey|CEO|Cork County Council::John Paul O'Shea|Councillor|Cork County Council::Michael Hegarty|Councillor|Cork County Council
Subject Matter: Flooding in Midleton Town over Christmas and early January
Intended Results: To develop and activate an immediate crisis response to the flooding in Midleton Distillery and the surrounding areas of Midleton Rugby Football Club, Lauriston Estate and Townspark Business Park adjacent to Midleton Distillery::Commitment from county council to develop an action plan to address future flooding and to offer any support or expertise from Irish Distillers as a significant local business and employer
Lobbying Activities: Emails to officials notifying them of immediate risk of flooding over Christmas period and follow-up emails to coordinate emergency response which included activity by Midleton Distillery staff and equipment.|Email|2-5::Meeting to discuss need for a long-term crisis response action plan to address future flooding efficiently and effectively and to offer Irish Distillers' expertise in as a significant local business and employer.|Meeting|1

Specific Details: Transport Priorities for Cork County Council
DPOs Lobbied: John Paul O'Shea|Councillor|Cork County Council::Rory Cocking|Councillor|Cork County Council::Anthony Barry|Councillor|Cork County Council::John Michael Foley|Councillor|Cork County Council::Caroline Cronin|Councillor|Cork County Council::Marie O'Sullivan|Councillor|Cork County Council::Michael Hegarty|Councillor|Cork County Council::Jack White|Councillor|Cork County Council
Subject Matter: Transport Priorities for Cork County Council
Intended Results: To exchange views and progress key priority areas in relation to transport in County Cork, including road projects and public transport, in a meeting with Fine Gael Councillors on Cork County Council.
Lobbying Activities: Meeting with Fine Gael Councillors on Cork County Council on 29th October 2024 in Cork County Hall to discuss transport priorities, including roads such as the R624, M20 and M28, and public transport projects and infrastructure.  |Meeting|1

Specific Details: Economic Development Priorities for Cork County Council
